alert.note: Alert for Henry; Jefferson; Lee; Van Buren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 04 at 7:46PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Henry, northeastern Van Buren, southeastern Jefferson and northwestern Lee Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 746 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Salem, or near Mount Pleasant, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Westwood around 750 PM CDT. Mount Pleasant around 755 PM CDT. Mount Union around 805 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Winfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
